intro: Dendropanax gonatopodus, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to eastern Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces berries that are toxic to humans. The botanical characteristics of Dendropanax gonatopodus make it an important species in the study of Australian flora.
